feed.title: TRUC and P2A for CTV fee management

entry.title: TRUC and P2A for CTV fee management
entry.summary: The email highlights the involvement in testing packages and P2A functionality with CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY on signet, pinpointing an apparent error in the README documentation. Specifically, it mentions that the example provided seems to be incorrect, directing attention to an output value discrepancy that can be verified through a transaction on Mempool Space. The link provided ([Mempool Space](https://mempool.space/signet/tx/86896275fb71d4e3b84d1edeeacb90f7c4ccf77ee3a29e66d7effff4bb0682fb)) allows for direct examination of the mentioned issue. Additionally, there's a casual mention of "/dev/fd0 floppy disk guy," which seems to be an informal sign-off or nickname, but this portion falls outside the main focus of the communication. This message originates from a Google Groups thread tied to Bitcoin Development, implying that the recipient is part of a community engaged in cryptocurrency technology discussions and development efforts.
